summary: This document is an email chain from September 2021 regarding a discovery request from the FBI Victim Services Division to its staff. The request seeks contact information for victims, witnesses, and their attorneys involved in the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell investigation (case 50D-NY-3027571) for an upcoming trial scheduled for November 29, 2021. It reveals internal FBI procedures for gathering victim communications for discovery purposes.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Identified as the attorney for victims in the Epstein/Maxwell case; her email address is requested as part of the discovery process.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the New York investigation referenced in the discovery request; his case is scheduled for trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-subject of the New York investigation referenced in the discovery request; her case is scheduled for trial alongside Epstein's.

connections.description: Allred is identified as an attorney representing victims in the criminal case against Epstein.
Allred is identified as an attorney representing victims in the criminal case against Maxwell.
Both are named as subjects of the same New York investigation and scheduled for trial.

events.title: Epstein/Maxwell Trial Date
events.description: The trial for the New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell (case 50D-NY-3027571) is scheduled to begin.

events.title: Discovery Request Initiated
events.description: The FBI Victim Program Management Unit sends a request to Victim Specialists for contact information of victims, witnesses, and attorneys involved in the Epstein/Maxwell case for discovery purposes.

events.title: Discovery Deadline
events.description: The deadline for Victim Specialists to provide requested victim/witness/attorney contact information to the FBI Program Manager.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively gathering contact information for victims, witnesses, and their attorneys in the Epstein/Maxwell case for discovery ahead of a November 2021 trial.
Attorney Gloria Allred is specifically named as representing victims in the case, with her email address being part of the requested discovery.
The document references a specific FBI case number for the New York investigation: 50D-NY-3027571.
The communication reveals internal FBI protocols for collecting victim communications (texts, emails, voicemails) to be turned over to the U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO).
The email chain indicates that some Victim Specialists had met with victims in person but had no electronic communication with them, highlighting the methods of victim contact.
